TopicTitle: See separation distance while adjusting maneuver node

Articles.Content:
Is there a way to see the separation distance while adjusting the maneuver node? Right now I mouse over the rendezvous point, then mouse over the maneuver node, adjust the mouse wheel, then mouse over the rendezvous point, repeat. It's a pain. I have to be doing this wrong. So is there a better way?

Thanks
Separation from what? A slight clarification would be helpful.

No, there isn't. Unlike for Pe Ap marker, the closet approach marker label can't be toggled to stay visible. It is only mouse over enabled.

And yes, it is annoying... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

You can use hotkeys with precise node, mouse over the closest approach flags then change your node with keyboard. Bit of a workaround and I never used the hotkeys for it myself, prefer to use the mouse for it. But it is an option

> 
> You can use hotkeys with precise node, mouse over the closest approach flags then change your node with keyboard. Bit of a workaround and I never used the hotkeys for it myself, prefer to use the mouse for it. But it is an option

Which hotkeys? W,A,S,D and I,J,K,L don't seem to work.
I think he was referring to Node editing hot keys you would get from installing the PreciseNode mod.
The default assignment for the PreciseNode hot keys are on the numpad
MechJeb's Rendezvous tool will tell you the encounter distance while you're fiddling with nodes.

You shouldn't really need it. When the lines in the center of each marker line up you're at your closest approach. 

If that doesn't get you close enough, install MechJeb and make a custom window that shows closest approach distance and tweak it with RCS.

Any Update to this issue?

Right now using Precise Node's Hotkeys, but would love to have a display somewhere about the distance to targest at closest approach.

Would love to have that in Kerbal Engineer Redux, but it offers time to closest approach only.

Kerbal Alarm Clock is able to show that too, but only when setting up the alarm. Do not want to install whole' mechjeb purely for this. NavHud doesn't show it either.

Any Ideas? Maybe i missed something?
